name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes: **Note:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with greatest extension.
footnotes:
\## Considered regional in Historic Stage
\*** Considered distant in 1977 Summary Staging Guide
rows:
In situ: Noninvasive; intraepithelial;
Bowen disease; intraepidermal

Localized only
     Infiltrates dermis
     Invades tarsal plate
     Involves full eyelid thickness
     Lesion(s) confined to dermis

Subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis)##
Stated as T1 or T2 (T2a, T2b, T2 [NOS])

Regional by direct extension only

Extension to:
    Adjacent structures including orbit***
    Underlying cartilage, bone, skeletal muscle***

Adjacent structures, including:
    Bulbar conjunctiva
    Globe
    Sclera

Complete resection requires enucleation, exenteration, or bone resection

Tumor unresectable, extensive invasion:
    Ocular structures
    Orbital structures

Stated as T3 (T3a, T3b, T3 [NOS])

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
